Description: Sherd from South Ionian(?) pottery plate with horizontal rim; maeander band enclosing Xs on rim; broad band at edge of floor, narrower one within; traces of frieze (?palmette); outside, group of vertical strokes on the edge of the rim, bands on body; fabric yellowish gray.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 39, no. C 1a)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.903)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: I.C 1a (cat. no. in Prins de Jong 1925)
